topic: Share patches for peer review before submitting to R Core.
text: set the channel topic: Share patches for peer review before submitting to R Core.

This channel (like the Slack in general) is for informal community support. The idea was to give a space where people could get feedback before posting to the R-devel mailing list or R's Bugzilla - this was in the description, but Slack hides that, so I've added it to the channel topic as well, to make this clearer.

text: Since you've posted to both R-devel and Bugzilla, you've done what you can to get R Core's attention and it seems you've got reasonably helpful replies from Tomas and Martin. I think Martin meant that it was for R Core + CRAN to decide what goes behind `--as-cran`. For such issues where it's not really a bug, but a policy decision, then raising it on R-devel for discussion would usually be the best approach, or probably even r-package-devel would be more appropriate in this case.
